channel.title: Firemaking v2
channel.description:
Better than my old release. This is including A shorter code than delta's creepy one. Working emote. Walking back when you lit the logs. TaskManager Clipping.
First copy this and paste it into a new file called firemaking.java http://pastebin.com/inPM37q2 [/code] Save and close now go to client and add the constructor this is an important part [code] public firemaking firemaking = new firemaking(this) [/code] Still in client add this in boolean process: [code] if(firemaking.litfire == true) { firemaking.litfire = false; fmwalkto(0, -1); } [/code] Now in your packet 53 (case 53) add this: [code] int[] LOGTYPE = { 1511, 1513, 1515, 1517, 1519, 1521 }; // id of c.logs for (int h = 0; h < LOGTYPE.length; h++) { // For lp if ((itemUsed == 590) && (useWith == LOGTYPE[h])) { c.firemaking.prelit(); } } [/code]
Media: [img]http://i46.tinypic.com/34pmk1s.png[/img]
If you find anybugs report them please.

item.title: Firemaking v2
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:469463”]It would be nice if the code followed some conventions.

It’s unnecessary to have a no-arg constructor, if the only way you’re instantiating the class is by passing a client to it.

You could move the items into an enum

public static enum Logs {
    NORMAL(item, experience, requiredLevel);

    private final int item;
    private final int experience;
    private final int requiredLevel;
}

Creating a new instance of the class is unnecessary, as it would be easier to pass the client as a variable

Firemaking.lightLog(client, logId); [/quote]
Thanks i’ll be sure to try to use those,
I’ve retabbed the code and uploaded it to pastebin, so it doesn’t get screwed when i paste it here.

Read full topic

item.title: Firemaking v2
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

It would be nice if the code followed some conventions.

It’s unnecessary to have a no-arg constructor, if the only way you’re instantiating the class is by passing a client to it.

You could move the items into an enum

public static enum Logs {
    NORMAL(item, experience, requiredLevel);

    private final int item;
    private final int experience;
    private final int requiredLevel;
}

Creating a new instance of the class is unnecessary, as it would be easier to pass the client as a variable

Firemaking.lightLog(client, logId);

Read full topic

item.title: Firemaking v2
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Better than my old release.
This is including
A shorter code than delta’s creepy one.
Working emote.
Walking back when you lit the logs.
TaskManager
Clipping.

First copy this and paste it into a new file called firemaking.java
http://pastebin.com/inPM37q2
[/code]
Save and close now go to client and add the constructor this is an important part

public firemaking firemaking = new firemaking(this)

Still in client add this in boolean process:

                           if(firemaking.litfire == true) {
					 firemaking.litfire = false;
					  fmwalkto(0, -1);
					 }

Now in your packet 53 (case 53)
add this:

                        int[] LOGTYPE = { 1511, 1513, 1515, 1517, 1519, 1521 }; // id of c.logs	
			for (int h = 0; h < LOGTYPE.length; h++) { // For lp
					 if ((itemUsed == 590) && (useWith == LOGTYPE[h])) {
					 c.firemaking.prelit();
					 }
}

Media:

34pmk1s.png772×509

If you find anybugs report them please.
